description: India-Maldives relations showed improvement as President Mohamed Muizzu met India's foreign minister, S Jaishankar, to inaugurate water and sanitation projects. Muizzu emphasized India's support as invaluable, while Jaishankar highlighted the partnership's motto. Both nations expressed commitment to strengthening ties, underscoring India's 'Neighborhood First' policy and dedication to the Global South.
title: Maldives President Muizzu meets Jaishankar, calls ‘India one of closest allies’

description: Hindenburg Research accused Sebi chairperson Madhabi Puri Buch and her husband of investing in offshore vehicles linked to the Adani group. The whistleblower documents claimed this compromised Sebi's probe into Adani's alleged corporate fraud. Despite market veterans deeming the report lacking in substance, this revelation raised questions about potential conflicts of interest within Sebi.
title: Now, Hindenburg questions Sebi chief, spouse's dealings

description: A 35-year-old volunteer, Sanjay Roy, was arrested within hours of a special investigation team being formed for the rape and murder of a 31-year-old postgraduate trainee doctor at Kolkata's RG Kar Hospital. The postmortem report confirmed sexual assault, and CCTV footage showed Roy entering the hospital premises intoxicated. The accused faces 14 days of police custody.
title: Volunteer held for rape-murder of Kolkata doctor; Will hang him, says CM Mamata

description: In Dhaka, student protests led to the resignation of Bangladesh’s chief justice, Obaidul Hassan, and five other top court judges. The interim government quickly appointed Syed Refaat Ahmed as the new chief justice, aiming to meet protesters' demands. The swift judicial changes follow the resignation of attorney general A M Amin Uddin earlier in the week.
title: Bangladesh chief justice quits after siege outside court
Three sisters drown in rainwater-filled pit in Madhya Pradesh

description: Union Home Minister Amit Shah announced the government's decision to advance the target of 20% ethanol blending in petrol from 2030 to 2025-26. He urged sugar cooperatives to boost ethanol production, emphasizing its benefits for the environment, sugar mills, and farmers. The announcement followed the cabinet's approval of the modified Pradhan Mantri JI-VAN Yojana.
title: Centre advances target for 20% ethanol-mixing in petrol to 2025-26

description: The Marxist Coordination Committee (MCC) merged with CPI(ML), as announced by leaders Haldhar Mahto and Raja Ram Singh. This merger aligns with MCC founder A K Rai's vision of unity among Communist parties. They believe it will bolster the fight for tribal and farmers' rights and challenge the BJP in Jharkhand.
title: MCC, CPI-ML merge to fight BJP in Jharkhand

description: Bareilly police's arrest of suspected serial killer Kuldeep Gangwar has drawn scrutiny for the striking similarity between a previously released sketch and his latest photograph. The investigation, involving extensive leads and interrogations, spanned 14 months. Doubts about the arrest's timing have been raised, compounded by claims from Kuldeep’s brother disputing his involvement in the crimes.
title: UP cops’ sketch of ‘serial killer’ exact match of latest pic, down to his shirt
SC notice to Kerala on HC’s Sabari head priest order

description: Two tourists from Trichy, identified as Anand Prabhu and Jeyakannan, died from suspected asphyxiation in a Kodaikanal hotel. They had cooked barbeque chicken on a charcoal stove and left it burning overnight. Their friends found them unconscious the next morning. Paramedics declared them dead, and an investigation has been initiated by Kodaikanal police.
title: Two die after inhaling smoke from charcoal stove in Kodai hotel

description: Congress expressed concern over reported targeted attacks on minorities and their places of worship in Bangladesh, urging the interim government to take steps to ensure their safety and dignity. This followed BJP's accusation that opposition parties were silent on the issues faced by Hindus and other minority communities in the neighbouring country.
title: Congress calls for ‘forceful steps’ to shield Bangladesh minorities

description: In an unprecedented move, five Bangladeshi refugees in relief camps at Sindhanur taluk, Karnataka, were granted Indian citizenship under the Citizenship Amendment Act (CAA). This marks the first instance of such a grant in the state. Among those awarded citizenship were Ramakrishnan Abhikari, Advith, Sukumar, Bipradas Golder, and Jayant Mandal. Approximately 146 refugees had filed for citizenship online.
title: 5 Bangladesh from Karnataka camps get citizenship

description: Shekhar Lal Goswami, a 12th generation family priest of the Sri Sri Siddheswari Kali Mandir in Dhaka, has vowed to stay despite the violence targeting minorities. Abducted twice during the 1971 liberation war, he survived with divine blessings. Now, students, including those from the majority community, are guarding the temple and Goswami.
title: 12th-gen priest vows to stay at Dhaka temple amid violence

description: In Thatha-Rashidpur village, Bihar, a couple and their 10-year-old daughter were murdered in their sleep. The assailants, who remain unidentified, also grievously injured the couple's five-year-old son. The bodies were later discovered with acid poured on them. Police are investigating, focusing on a possible land dispute involving the deceased.
title: Bihar couple, minor daughter killed in sleep

description: Finance Secretary TV Somanathan was appointed as the new Cabinet Secretary, replacing Rajiv Gauba. A key figure in bringing transparency to the Union Budget and handling pandemic expenditures, Somanathan's term begins on August 30. He's also played a role in minimizing off-budget borrowing. His elevation suggests a top deck reshuffle in the government.
title: TV Somanathan to replace Rajiv Gauba as cabinet secretary
Cong attacks Modi on ‘Har Ghar Tiranga’

description: The government of Kerala had a corpus of Rs 540 crore in disaster funds, with Rs 395 crore in the disaster response fund and Rs 145 crore released by the Centre after landslides. Kerala had received Rs 2,225 crore in five years for disaster response, but several states, including Kerala, had not utilized these funds fully for mitigation projects.
title: Kerala had Rs 540 crore in disaster funds a day after tragedy: Centre

description: Congress president Mallikarjun Kharge condemned the Supreme Court's suggestion to include 'creamy layer' exclusion for Dalits regarding quotas. He urged the government to nullify this part of the judgement, alleging a BJP conspiracy to end reservations. The Congress plans to set up a committee to consult on sub-categorisation issues related to the judgement.
title: Govt should’ve brought bill to nullify SC ‘creamy layer’ verdict: Kharge

description: The government disclosed on Saturday that there's no official provision to classify a natural calamity as a national disaster, as clarified in a 2013 Lok Sabha reply by then junior home minister Mullappally Ramachandran. The UPA minister indicated that severe calamities are assessed case-by-case, with additional assistance considered from the NDRF when necessary, following an established procedure.
title: ‘No rule to tag natural calamity national disaster, UPA govt said in 2013’
Garment sector hit by Bangladesh unrest: FM Sitharaman

description: The government and RBI urged banks to enhance deposit mobilisation using innovative strategies, addressing competition from other investment products. Finance Minister Nirmala Sitharaman and RBI Governor Shaktikanta Das emphasized the importance of balancing lending and deposits. Banks are encouraged to find new methods to attract deposits without relying on policy interventions.
title: Focus more on mobilising deposits: Govt, RBI to banks

description: Over 1,000 demonstrators marched to Vidhan Bhavan in Nagpur, trying to breach its premises and hoist the Vidarbha flag as part of a pro-Vidarbha statehood movement. Police detained 350 protesters and removed the flags. Organized by Vidarbha Rajya Andolan Samiti and Jai Vidarbha Party, the protest highlighted regional unemployment issues and statehood aspirations.
title: Pro-Vidarbha statehood stir hits Nagpur, 350 detained

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi visited Wayanad district in Kerala, devastated by the July 30 landslide. He assured full support from the Central government for relief and rehabilitation efforts. Modi emphasized that the nation stands with the victims and pledged that the Center would provide necessary funds and support for rebuilding infrastructure and securing survivors' futures.
title: In Wayanad, PM promises all help for relief & rehab

description: A 70-year-old man, Sidappa, was killed in Bengaluru district after advising Puneet Nayak against spitting on the road. Sidappa had reprimanded Nayak previously for similar actions, including improper garbage disposal. This time, Nayak reacted violently, leading to Sidappa's fatal attack. Nayak, aged 23, has been arrested for the murder.
title: Karnataka man, 70, protests spitting on road, is killed with machete

description: Indian nationals serving voluntarily in the Russian Army are facing delays in their discharge, causing potential strain in Moscow-New Delhi relations. Russia maintains these individuals voluntarily contracted for service, though India suggests many were misled. The Russian embassy is coordinating with Indian agencies for their early release and has expressed condolences for the eight Indians killed in the conflict.
title: Indians voluntarily joined our army, working to discharge them: Russia

description: A gym trainer named Dharav was rescued from Airoli creek after being stranded in the water for three days. His father, Mahindra Narkar, expressed relief and gratitude for his son's survival. Dharav had left home after a video showing him 'assaulting' a gym mate went viral, leading to a police case and subsequent disappearance.
title: Gym trainer ‘jumps into creek’, found after 3 days

description: A sessions court in Mumbai acquitted a couple accused of murdering Sonali Chari's husband after they spent seven years in jail. The court cited a flawed investigation, lack of evidence showing a romantic link, and uncollected crucial data such as CDRs. The case's mishandling raised serious questions about the probe's integrity.
title: After 7-year jail, couple held for killing woman's hubby let off

description: India was set to commission its second nuclear-powered submarine, INS Arighat, armed with nuclear missiles, strengthening its strategic deterrence. Constructed at Vizag, the submarine underwent extensive trials. The project also included two nuclear-powered attack submarines with conventional weapons. The development came amid increased naval activities by China in the Indian Ocean region.
title: India 'fully ready' to add to fleet 2nd sub with N-tipped missiles

description: Wildlife experts suggested involving local communities near tiger reserves in Uttar Pradesh in conservation efforts to reduce man-wildlife conflicts. Referencing successful community-based programs in Nepal, they proposed starting with Pilibhit Tiger Reserve. Nepal's approach includes military protection, financial assistance for attack victims, and crop insurance, resulting in a significant increase in tiger numbers and minimal human-wildlife conflict.
title: UP’s tiger reserves need community-based wildlife conservation: Experts

description: Two Army soldiers died and four others were injured in a shootout with terrorists in Anantnag, Kashmir. The encounter, which also wounded two civilians, raises the security toll in J&K to 16 since May. Security forces have intensified operations in the region, where challenging terrain provides cover for the terrorists. Reinforcements have been deployed.
title: 2 soldiers killed, security toll in J&K rises to 16 since May

description: Donald Trump is adamant on his comment doubting Kamala Harris' ethnicity between Black and Indian though his campaign might have suffered from the remark that he first made in Chicago. Trump said he was not sure whether Kamala Harris was Indian or Black because before 'turning' Black, Kamala Harris emphasized on his Indian roots.
title: When Trump said 'I think I was right' after 'Kamala Harris Black or Indian' remark
Uddhav Thackeray’s convoy attacked with cow dung; over 20 held

description: The ad-hoc division of the Court of Arbitration for Sport (CAS) will take some more time to deliberate on Indian wrestler Vinesh Phogat's appeal against her disqualification from the women's 50kg freestyle final of the Olympic Games and will announce its decision only on August 13.
title: CAS defers decision on Vinesh's appeal till August 13

description: The article delved into real-life rivalries among professional wrestlers, highlighting famed disputes such as Bret Hart vs. Shawn Michaels, Edge vs. Matt Hardy, and CM Punk vs. Ryback. It discussed how these intense feuds extended beyond the ring, affecting personal relationships and building long-standing animosities within the wrestling world.
title: Professional Wrestlers Who Hate Each Other In Real Life

description: Indian javelin star Neeraj Chopra emphasized the importance of separating sports from geopolitical tensions after his mother, Saroj Devi, praised Pakistan’s Arshad Nadeem for winning gold at the Paris 2024 Olympics. Neeraj echoed her sentiments, highlighting the deep connection athletes share, regardless of nationality, and stressed that while sports foster unity, border issues are beyond their control. Neeraj also supported the idea of India hosting the 2036 Olympics, viewing it as a positive step for Indian sports.
title: 'What happens on the border is...': Neeraj on IND-PAK rivalry

description: Indian wrestler Reetika Hooda put up a stout defence against top seed Aiperi Medet Kyzy before losing the women's 76kg quarterfinal bout, which turned into an intense power struggle at the Paris Olympics in Paris on Saturday.
title: Explained: Why Reetika lost in QFs despite a tied 1-1 bout
N Korea launches more trash balloons towards South Korea: Seoul military
'Watch out ...': Dhankhar attacks Cong over 'can happen in India too' remark on B'desh unrest
Kolkata doc murder: IMA gives authorities 48-hour ultimatum to take action, warns of protests

description: Prime Minister Narendra Modi reached out to wrestler Aman Sehrawat, who secured a bronze medal in the men's freestyle 57kg event at the Paris Olympics.
title: 'Your life is an inspiration': PM Modi praises Aman Sehrawat

description: Indian shooter and Olympic bronze medallist Sarabjot Singh, 22, turned down a prestigious Deputy Director role in Haryana's Sports Department to focus on his shooting career. Despite pressure from his family to secure a stable job, Sarabjot emphasized his commitment to the sport. His decision follows his recent success at the Paris Olympics, where he won a bronze medal in the 10m air pistol mixed team event. He received a hero's welcome in his hometown, Dheen village, Ambala district, Haryana.
title: Olympic medallist Sarabjot rejects government job, says...

description: The Supreme Court's decision to allow states to create sub-groups within the 15% Scheduled Caste quota has prompted criticism from Congress. They questioned implementing a 'creamy layer' amidst a backlog and expressed concerns about BJP's intentions towards reservation. Congress vowed to oppose the decision, citing continued untouchability as justification for ongoing reservations.
title: 'Govt should nullify ... ': What Congress said on SC's 'creamy layer' observation
Is Hasina still B'desh PM? What her son Sajeeb Wazed said

description: "I feel it is necessary to share a special news with you. Our chief justice has resigned a few minutes back. His resignation letter has already reached the law ministry. We will send it to the president without delay for taking necessary measures," Asif Nazrul, law, justice and parliamentary affairs adviser to the interim government,  said.​​
title: Bangladesh crisis: Why protesting students forced Chief Justice to resign
Two soldiers killed, 3 hurt in encounter with terrorists in J&K's Anantnag

description: Former YouTube CEO Susan Wojcicki passed away after a two-year battle with cancer, as revealed by Google CEO Sundar Pichai on X. Wojcicki joined Google in 1999 and led YouTube from 2014 to 2023.
title: Former YouTube CEO dies, Sundar Pichai shares heartfelt tribute

description: Meta CEO Mark Zuckerberg praised DeepMind co-founder Demis Hassabis for his negotiating tactics during Google's acquisition of the AI lab in 2014. Zuckerberg disclosed that Facebook had been in talks to buy DeepMind before Google secured the deal for over $500 million, highlighting Hassabis's skill in leveraging competing offers. The negotiations underscored the tech giants' race in AI development.
title: ‘Respect’: Fb founder on how DeepMind CEO negotiated with Google
